candidates.name: Keisha Lance Bottoms
candidates.background: Former Atlanta Mayor (2018-2022) and Senior Advisor to President Biden. Led Atlanta through civil unrest following George Floyd's murder and the COVID-19 pandemic. Known for pragmatic leadership and national Democratic Party prominence.
experience: Senior Advisor to President Biden for Public Engagement
keyIssues: Criminal justice reform and public safety

candidates.name: Jason Esteves
candidates.background: Atlanta City Council member representing Midtown and parts of Buckhead. First openly gay man elected to Atlanta City Council. Background in urban planning and community development with focus on transit and affordable housing.
experience: Urban planner and community development professional
Advocate for LGBTQ+ rights and inclusive policies

candidates.name: Derrick Jackson
candidates.background: Former Rome City Commissioner and community organizer from Northwest Georgia. Represents rural Democratic voice often underrepresented in statewide races. Focus on economic development in rural communities and bridging urban-rural divide.
keyIssues: Rural economic development and job creation

candidates.name: Ruwa Romman
candidates.background: Georgia State Representative from District 97 (Gwinnett County). First Muslim woman elected to Georgia General Assembly. Former systems engineer with focus on technology policy, healthcare, and representation of diverse communities.
experience: Community organizer and advocate for diverse representation

candidates.name: Michael Thurmond
candidates.background: DeKalb County CEO and former Georgia Labor Commissioner. Long record of public service including state legislature. Known for strong administrative skills, fiscal management, and delivering results in large government operations.

candidates.name: Geoff Duncan
candidates.background: Former Lieutenant Governor (2019-2023) running as moderate Republican. Became prominent critic of election denialism after 2020. Former entrepreneur and minor league baseball player. May appeal to moderate Republicans and independents.
candidates.notes: Running as Republican but may be crossover appeal candidate

candidates.name: Olu Brown
candidates.background: Senior Pastor of Impact Church, one of the fastest-growing multi-ethnic churches in America. Author and community leader with focus on social justice, economic empowerment, and faith-based organizing. No prior elected office experience.
experience: Community organizer and social justice advocate
